note.p: Birth Place: Harden Hall, near Stockport, Cheshire, England
Baptism: Harden Hall, near Stockport (12 October 1636)
Education: Holton School; Christ's College, Cambridge; BA (1656), MB (1658), DD (Dublin) 1671; Incorporated at Oxford (1673)

Career: Ordained deacon and priest (1660-1); Vicar of Holy Cross, Canterbury (1662); Rector of St Mildred, Canterbury (1662-1666); Perpetual Curate of St Botolph, Aldgate (1666-1682); Rector of Thornton-Le-Moor, Lincolnshire (1667-1691); Rector of Davenham, Cheshire (1682-1686); Vicar of Neston (1687-1691); Dean of Chester (1682-1691); Chaplain to Charles II
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Venn; Foster; Hunter
Notes: Different death dates given in DNB: 18 Aug, 15 Sep, and 18 Sep. Venn has 18 Sept.
